Package support

Class BookingManager

java.lang.Object
support.BaseBookingManager
support.BookingManager
public class BookingManager
extends BaseBookingManager
This creates bookings in rooms, for a given university
  • The booking system is responsible for most functionalities. It has a list of bookable rooms, a list of assistants on shift, and a list of bookings.
  • This class must be able to manage general functionalities on these lists, i.e., you should implement functions to add, remove, and to show bookable rooms, assistants on shift, and bookings.
  • There is a time-slot concept that will guide the booking system. For instance, rooms will be available, and assistants will work at a specific time-slot, i.e., date, time and duration. Hence, tests should be booked at available slots.
  • 4. Every time-slot has a fixed duration â€“ a positive number representing the duration of a test, in minutes. This quantity includes the time spent doing the test and the time to sanitize the room. The current policy establishes this duration to be 60 minutes.

Time slots should be 60 minutes apart

  • Method Details

    • generateTimeSlots

      private void generateTimeSlots()
      Generate a list of timeSlots for n weeks ahead, with the correct number of timeslots per day, this can all be changed in the config.properties file.

    • generateRoomTimeslots

      private void generateRoomTimeslots()
      This takes the preset indices for time slots (defined in the CSV files), and adds the corresponding time slot to the room's bookable timeslots

    • getTimeSlots

      public java.util.ArrayList<TimeSlot> getTimeSlots()
      Returns:
      An arraylist of TimeSlots for the current instance

    • getAvailableTimeSlots

      public java.util.ArrayList<TimeSlot> getAvailableTimeSlots()
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of timeslots which have available assistants, and rooms

    • getTimeSlotOptions

      public java.util.ArrayList<BaseMenuOption> getTimeSlotOptions()
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of MenuOptions that are preloaded for that timeslot, and will automatically pass it forward to the BaseBookingManager.createBooking(TimeSlot, String) method.

    • getTimeSlotForStartTime

      public TimeSlot getTimeSlotForStartTime​(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
      This function does not rely on direct user input, first the data is cleaned. It is used in the process for converting user inputted Dates, and Times.
      See TimeSlot.cleanDateTime(LocalDate, LocalTime) for how it is cleaned up ready for compatible searching
      Parameters:
      dateTime - Start time to match a timeSlot to
      Returns:
      The time slot with the matching start time

    • deleteBookableRoomOptions

      public java.util.ArrayList<BaseMenuOption> deleteBookableRoomOptions()
      Generates the arraylist of BaseMenuOption which call the removeBookableRoom(Room, TimeSlot) function on a, usually given, instance
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of BaseMenuOption for deleting bookable rooms

    • formattedBookableRooms

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> formattedBookableRooms()
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings with the formatted details of the room in a bookable way

    • addBookableRoom

      public Room addBookableRoom​(Room room, java.time.LocalDate date, java.time.LocalTime time)
      Parameters:
      room - The room to make bookable
      date - The date to make the room bookable on
      time - The time to make the room bookable at
      Returns:
      The updated room, note that the given instance's room list is also updated

    • removeBookableRoom

      public void removeBookableRoom​(Room room, TimeSlot timeSlot)
      Parameters:
      room - The room to make un-bookable
      timeSlot - The timeslot to remove the bookable status from

    • tsAssistantOptionMap

      public java.util.ArrayList<BaseMenuOption> tsAssistantOptionMap()
      Overflow for tsAssistantOptionMap(boolean), where creation is true
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of BaseMenuOptions which combine Assistants, and Time slots, and have the function addToShift(Assistant, LocalDate), with the local date already filled

    • tsAssistantOptionMap

      public java.util.ArrayList<BaseMenuOption> tsAssistantOptionMap​(boolean creation)
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of BaseMenuOptions which combine Assistants, and Time slots, and have the function addToShift(Assistant, LocalDate), with the local date already filled

    • tsAssistantMap

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tsAssistantMap()
      Maps together the assistants and time slots in order to display them in the AssistantsOnShiftList menu.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Strings which combine Assistants, and Time slots

    • addToShift

      public void addToShift​(Assistant assistant, java.time.LocalDate localDate)
      This method is invoked by AddAssistantsOnShitMenu.performCreation(String). Note that shifts for Assistants reoccur weekly, so removing them from shift this week, will add them to all subsequent weeks. Only the day of the week is stored (0 = Monday).
      Parameters:
      assistant - The assistant to be put on shift

    • removeFromShift

      public void removeFromShift​(Assistant assistant, TimeSlot timeSlot)
      Note that shifts for Assistants reoccur weekly, so removing them from shift this week, will remove them from all subsequent weeks. Only the day of the week is stored (0 = Monday).
      Parameters:
      assistant - The assistant to take off shift
      timeSlot - The timeslot to remove them from

    • getRooms

      public java.util.ArrayList<Room> getRooms()
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of the current instance's Rooms.
